image.altText: Salmon pens photographed through trees.

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Salmon Tasmania says the decision to pause marine farming expansion is "shameless" and contradicts promises made by Premier Jeremy Rockliff in July.

title.children: 'No industry is safe': Salmon workers respond to halt on fish farm growth

image.altText: A man with glasses speaks to media at night time.

props.synopsis: When the Tasmanian parliament resumes to determine who should govern the state, it will be reminiscent of the first day of parliament in 1989. But where the similarities will end remains to be seen.

title.children: Memories of Robin Gray's 1989 downfall as Tasmanian parliament returns

image.altText: A man with grey hair speaking

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Labor-leader-turned-independent MP David O'Byrne will offer confidence and supply to the Rockliff government in a move that could help the Liberal party maintain its hold on power.

title.children: 'It's not been an easy decision': Key independent David O'Byrne delivers support to Liberals

image.altText: A young couple sitting in a shed, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: It's becoming easier for Australian households to live off-grid, but how much could it cost and what are the benefits?

title.children: The reasons why there's a renewed interest in off-grid living

image.altText: Maureen Armstrong 1

props.synopsis: Tasmania is in the midst of a horror year for road deaths. For mothers who have lost children, the pain is beyond comprehension.

title.children: 'You don't believe it's real': Grieving mothers issue warning as road toll soars

image.altText: Children smiling for a photo in a library wearing costumes of storybook characters

props.synopsis: While some people love the chance to get creative with book week costumes, others see it as an expensive chore. Costume libraries are offering outfits to students, to make sure everyone is included.

title.children: Book week can be expensive and stressful but donated costumes are helping

image.altText: A crowd of people holding israeli flags and yellow flags

props.synopsis: Thousands of Israelis rally in Tel Aviv, Jerusalem and other cities, calling for a ceasefire and a hostage deal to be reached.

title.children: Israelis stage nationwide protests to demand end to Gaza war and release of hostages

image.altText: A render of a house.

props.synopsis: The details of property developer Amir Abu Abara's lengthy court case can only now be revealed — five years after he illegally cleared land at Barden Ridge in Sydney's south.

title.children: 'Damage is done': Trees illegally cut down to build luxury mansion

image.altText: Two women holding a baby sitting at a cafe by the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Parents of young children are looking at alternative options to daycare centres as the sector and governments troubleshoot child safety and compliance issues.

title.children: Parents warned about hiring nannies in move away from formal daycares

image.altText: Michelle Rowland mid-speech while wearing a black blazer in front of a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Reports of children being abused in childcare have sent politicians and policymakers into overdrive, searching for solutions. A big question remains: Do we need to be brave enough to start again?

title.children: The big question facing the government on childcare safety reform

image.altText: Santos sign

props.synopsis: The battle for control of oil and gas giant Santos moved up a gear this week after Ryan Stokes, chairman of Beach Energy and son of billionaire Kerry, took a swipe at the Abu Dhabi government's tilt for a large slice of Australia's energy market.

title.children: Disturbing history behind company in Santos takeover bid

image.altText: Passengers line up for security screening at the airport.

props.synopsis: International travel has been in the spotlight recently, with nerve-wracking tales of border crackdowns in the US and unexpected detentions. Here's what your passport reveals about you when you're travelling.

title.children: Think your passport is just ID? Here's what border officials really know about you

image.altText: Four men sit in the foreground, facing a flood ravaged scene, as mountains frame the background

props.synopsis: Pakistani authorities defend their response to devastating flooding across the country's north-western district as the death toll there surpasses 300.

title.children: Pakistan defends flood response after hundreds killed

image.altText: A man watches the information screens at the ASX

props.synopsis: The ASX is set to follow the lead of Wall Street, which slipped on Friday after a two-week rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to retreat, Qantas fine looms

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: REA Group appoints Carsales boss as CEO

image.altText: Terence Stamp at a red carpet night in 2012.

props.synopsis: The London-born actor shot to fame in the 1960s and later counted Princess Diana as a friend.

title.children: Priscilla and Superman star Terence Stamp dies aged 87

image.altText: A road witha few police cars on the side.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to Green Road at Regents Park on Sunday morning after a crash involving a ute and two pedestrians.

title.children: Manslaughter charges laid after death of father and 4yo son near Brisbane

image.altText: A man in a laboratory wearing a white jacket and safety glasses with a device in his hand

props.synopsis: As Australians figure out how to live with so-called "forever chemicals", we ask three leading PFAS experts to answer the most common questions about these substances, what the risks are, and what can be done to manage our use and exposure.

title.children: Three PFAS experts answer common questions about 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A young woman stands with arms wide and a huge smile in front of a rundown, old church on the back of a truck.

props.synopsis: When Jess saw a neglected chapel on Facebook Marketplace, she knew she had to buy it. Now, four years and hundreds of jars of rosella jam later, the transformation is heavenly.

title.children: Family renovates century-old chapel, one jar of jam at a time

image.altText: forest lodge shooting

props.synopsis: A shooting that left one man dead and another seriously injured in inner Sydney is described by police as a "brazen and callous attack".

title.children: One man dead, another seriously injured in 'brazen' targeted inner-city shooting

image.altText: Xavier Cooks rises to the basket as he prepares to dunk

props.synopsis: Australia survives a frantic finish to lift the Asia Cup for the third time in a row with a 90-89 victory over China in Jeddah.

title.children: Boomers hold on against China to claim third straight Asia Cup

image.altText: A man in paramedic high-vis uniform with a snowy mountain behind him.

props.synopsis: Paramedics based at Perisher Valley in New South Wales require specialist alpine and vehicle training to treat patients in the snow.

title.children: Snow fleet helps paramedics treat injured patients on the slopes

image.altText: A close

props.synopsis: It comes more than four years after he left Hong Kong, where he faces criminal charges over his involvement in the 2019 pro-democracy protests.

title.children: Former pro-democracy Hong Kong activist granted asylum in Australia

image.altText: White foam bobs on the surface of a river.

props.synopsis: An Australian-first scientific paper published on the bubble bath effect has established what is causing the phenomenon, as its author calls for more warnings along the Belubula River.

title.children: Farmers find fresh PFOS foam in central-west NSW river

image.altText: A woman sitting on a chair in the backyard of her home.

props.synopsis: Banning or restricting short-stay accommodation fails to provide meaningful increases to housing supply, a new study finds.

title.children: Short-term rental advocates say restrictions hurt tourism, not help housing

image.altText: A double storey brown and cream brick home behind a brown brick fence with a black wrought iron gate on a cloudy day.

props.synopsis: A man and two teenagers have been charged after a husband, wife and grandparents were hurt during an alleged confrontation inside the Melbourne home.

title.children: Charges after father stabbed 11 times in alleged Kew East home invasion

image.altText: A white woman, purple bob hair cut, white blazer, black top sitting in chair in NT parliament.

props.synopsis: Late last month, the NT government provided its long-awaited formal response to a landmark domestic violence inquiry, stating most of the recommendations are already in place. But is that the case?

title.children: Has the NT government made any progress on a landmark DV inquiry?

image.altText: Young woman holding a learner driver L-plate

props.synopsis: Learner drivers across the state are having to wait up to two months to take their driving test and in some cases are struggling to find a booking at all.

title.children: Learners facing lengthy wait times to sit their driving tests

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Police hope to speak with a man who stopped to help at the scene of a fatal three-vehicle crash on the Kamilaroi Highway near Wee Waa.

title.children: Teen dies in crash involving tractor, semitrailer and horse truck

image.altText: A medium shot of store front.

props.synopsis: Illicit tobacco is a national problem, but WA's police commissioner is concerned the state's weaker laws and penalties will make it attractive for organised crime.

title.children: Police want more powers to deal with WA's illegal tobacco industry

image.altText: Zippy Fish of the Swans kicks the ball .

props.synopsis: Sydney superstar and co-captain Chloe Molloy says "the talent is insane" in the new crop of AFLW players who have debuted over the weekend.

title.children: Why AFLW stars and experts think this superdraft is going to 'change the game'

image.altText: an aerial shot a light plane that crash landed on mona vale golf course

props.synopsis: An instructor pilot and student were on board the Piper Cherokee aircraft when it crash landed on the course at Mona Vale Golf Club.

title.children: Two people walk away after light plane crashes on Sydney golf course

image.altText: Imagine childcare sign reading under new management.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Department of Education says the change of service name will have no impact on investigations.

title.children: North Queensland childcare centre rebrands amid investigations

image.altText: A composite image of three people

props.synopsis: Teachers, police, nurses and midwives — they make up a tick over 63 per cent of the public sector in Queensland, and right now the state government is negotiating new pay deals with all of them.

title.children: 'Tricky spot': Queensland government wrangling three pay deals at once
